intro: Lirianthe liliifera, commonly known as the white lirianthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. It has lance-shaped leaves and a fibrous root system, which helps it thrive in moist, shaded environments. Lirianthe liliifera is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
